00074 /*  You shouldn't use "using" directives in a header file, but the code gets
00075     nearly unreadable otherwise:
00076     typename std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00077     And because I'm defining template classes here, code must be written in the
00078     header file anyway.
00079 */
00080 using VecMath::Vector;
00081 using std::vector;
00082 
00083 #include <iomanip>
00084 
00085 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::print() {
00086     std::cerr << _dimension << "-dimensional object: ";
00087     std::string separator = "";
00088     for(typename vector<Vector<D> >::iterator i = X().begin();
00089         i != X().end(); ++i){
00090         std::cerr << separator << *i;
00091         separator = ", ";
00092     }
00093     std::cerr << "\n";
00094 
00095 #   if 1
00096         std::cerr << "Surfaces: \n";
00097         for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00098             std::cerr << std::setw(4) << i << " (";
00099             separator = "";
00100             for (uintvec1D::iterator j = surface()[i].begin();
00101                  j != surface()[i].end(); ++j) {
00102                 std::cerr << separator << std::setw(4) << *j;
00103                 separator = ", ";
00104             }
00105             std::cerr << ")\n";
00106         }
00107         std::cerr << "\n";
00108 #   endif
00109 
00110 }
00111 
00118 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00119                                                       unsigned v3, unsigned v4) {
00120     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() ||
00121         v3 >= X().size() || v4 >= X().size()) {
00122         std::cerr << "X.size(): " << X().size() << ", v1: " << v1 << ", v2: " << v2
00123                 << ", v3: " << v3 << ", v4: " << v4 << "\n";
00124         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00125                                 "than size of vertex array");
00126     }
00127 
00128     uintvec1D tmp;
00129     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3); tmp.push_back(v4);
00130 
00131     surface().push_back(tmp);
00132 }
00133 
00139 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00140                                                       unsigned v3) {
00141     addSurface(v1, v2, v3, v3);
00142 }
